meanings.definition: Provide evidence to support or prove the truth of
meanings.sent1: She needed to substantiate her claim with facts.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used data to substantiate his theory.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to substantiate the alibi but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: His actions substantiate his loyalty to the team.
meanings.sent5: The photograph helped to substantiate the witness's testimony.

meanings.definition: To give concrete form or substance to
meanings.sent1: Adding more details will help to substantiate the story.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor worked hard to substantiate his vision in the statue.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to substantiate the flavor with a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to substantiate the joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The paint strokes helped to substantiate the artist's emotions.

meanings.definition: To establish by proof or competent evidence
meanings.sent1: The lawyer needed to substantiate her argument in court.
meanings.sent2: The document will substantiate the ownership of the property.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to substantiate his trick with a funny twist.
meanings.sent4: His hard work will substantiate his success in the future.
meanings.sent5: The experiment results will substantiate the hypothesis.
